item.title: Data Scientist, Enterprise Data Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Enterprise Advanced Analytics team is a central hub of data science expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. As a Data Scientist you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from client facing to operational, risk and capital markets. You’ll work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with the most exciting new companies in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage in collaborations with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: Under the guidance of Sr. Data Scientist or Director, conduct detailed analysis of data and provide advanced analytics solutions to solve business problem leveraging traditional statistical, machine learning and optimization techniques. Conduct guided research, typically on the non-traditional resources to solve business problems.

  • Business Consulting: Participate in business requirements gathering and problem assessment. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to select the most suitable procedure/approach that provides the optimum solutions to business problems. Conduct in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generation and cost saving opportunities under the guidance of Sr. Data Scientist or Director.  

  • Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators and collaborators who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working with large datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL or Hive, Spark). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as Python, SAS or R. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages such as Enterprise Miner, Pandas, Scikit-Learn.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing in M.S. or PhD from the quantitative analytics fields.

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 21st Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Advanced Analytics, Apache Spark, Big Data, Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematical Optimization, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Python, Structured Query Language (SQL)

item.title: Sr. Director, Advanced Analytics& AI
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the VP, Advanced Analytics and AI , this role is responsible of Advanced Analytics delivery and support of AI Enablement in CIBC. This role is designed to accelerate the adoption of advanced analytics within CIBC by building on key data and analytics relationships, creating new ones with infrastructure and business groups and external vendors as well as leading our external AI research partnerships.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Drive data and analytics strategy: Support the roll-out of enterprise-wide data and analytics strategy

  • Advanced Analytics use case delivery: Lead and execute against our annual KPIs by delivering advanced analytics driven business solutions with our business partners.

  • External Research Partnerships: Be responsible of our external research partnerships, participate in relevant forums, encourage and lead project participation and bring the knowledge back in a shareable format.

  • Provide Leadership: Provide strong leadership and effective engagement of team members to develop a high performing team by aligning goals with strategic enterprise priorities, building capabilities, modeling CIBC Purpose and core values, and fostering equity.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5+ years of experience in leading advanced analytics teams including extensive experience with building advanced analytics solutions for various businesses.

  • You understand the value of storytelling. You know how to explain the business value of the solutions you/your team builds.

  • You’re passionate with what you do that when you talk about solving business problems by leveraging advanced analytics solutions, everyone around you is infected by your passion.  

  • You’re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success.  You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You’re driven to succeed.  You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You’re inquisitive.  You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information.  You’re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • Values matter to you.  You bring your real self and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive 100% commission based compensation plan, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 21st Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Director, Data Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Director specializing in data science, you’ll be responsible for building the strategy and complex advanced models and AI capabilities for CIBC’s products, services and processes. The Director will also be capable of leading teams of Data Engineers and Software Developers who will leverage their Big Data skills to develop data assets that can be leveraged by the data science team to build advanced models and AI capabilities.

This role is a senior position within the Analytics team and requires a hands-on approach to solving problems, planning and managing change related to all aspects of the client-facing roles related to Analytics and AI initiatives. 

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Champion the use of advanced analytics for solving business problems: Work with various business units to understand their needs, opportunities and pain points.

  • Successfully manage and deliver on key analytical initiatives: Work across the various CIBC lines of business.

  • Oversee and complete the implementation and evaluation of proposed models: Create and validate statistical and ML based approaches that deal with complex data sets.

  • Work closely with business subject matter experts: Understand the context of business problems, perform deep dives on data collection and transformations and develop novel features to enhance model performance.

  • See analytics work through to completion: Oversee the model deployment and handoff to the line of business.

  • Support modelling efforts: Periodically refresh or revise as business needs evolve.

  • Become the trusted analytical partner for the leadership of the various CIBC lines of business: Focus on client / partner satisfaction. Mentor junior data scientists on modelling and coding best practices, as well as coaching on how to make analytical work relevant to business partners.

  • Help teams in Advanced Analytics tell a business story: Develop executive presentations that will support their initiatives.

  • Provide subject matter expertise on business analytics: Integrate and align business initiatives with Advance Analytics mandates and objectives.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate advanced knowledge of decision science, data science, advanced modelling and advanced analytical techniques.

  • You have extensive hands-on experience with modern data science and machine learning languages and toolkits including: Python, Pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost, Tensorflow, Pytorch, SQL. Additionally, you have strong coding skills, knowledge of DevOps tooling and and experience with one or more cloud services.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have an M.S. or Ph.D. in Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, or equivalent degree.

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-CC North 26th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be part of a dynamic team that provides advanced analytics services to assist Business Controls with effective risk management. You’ll lead the design, development, and implementation of actionable analytics solutions which help in strengthening the risk profiles across Personal and Small Business Banking. You’ll collaborate with partners from Business Controls, Risk Management, Product, and Frontline to identify and address emerging risk trends by leveraging data and analytics.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Collaboration – Continuous collaboration with internal and external partners is key to success. Be open-minded, constantly acquire new knowledge, and share ideas to improve existing processes.
  • Communication – Actively listen to understand a business problem and effectively articulate data analysis and interpretation using language that resonates with your audience.
  • Consulting – Methodically break down complex business problems, deliver recommendations and grow solutions to create sustainable progress for our projects and programs.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in using analytical, data management, and visualization tools such as R, Python, SAS, SQL, Tableau, VBA. Knowledge of CIBC data sources/applications/ platforms is an asset. 3+ years of work experience in a fast paced analytics environment.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy wrangling large data sets and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You are a forward thinker. From building strategic solutions to writing good code/unit tests, you follow best practices with the intent of creating sustainable impact far into the future.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, curiosity drives you to go above and beyond, and you take pride in building trust with your partners through your work.
  • You have completed a Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field or equal work experience preferred.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 23rd Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Advanced Analytics, Business Analytics, Custom Web Application Development, Data Analysis, Data Management, Development Tools, Identifying Opportunities, Teamwork, Web Application Development

item.title: Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics (RESL)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing­­

The Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking Real Estate Secured Lending product line. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader and subject matter expert in Real Estate Secured Lending– Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements

  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.

  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.

  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.

  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).

  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).

  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).

  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.

  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Actionable Insights, Advanced Analytics, Alteryx, Big Data, Consulting, Dashboard Creation, Dashboards Design, IBM Cognos Business Intelligence, Problem Solving, Python, R Code, SAS Platform, Statistics, Structured Query Language (SQL), Tableau, Taking Initiative

item.title: Sr. Consultant , BI Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Consultant, BI  Analytics reporting to the Director, BI and Strategy, Analytics and Decision Science and will be accountable for the day-to-day and strategic opportunities that align with the Personal and Business Banking Strategy. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead the delivery of data driven insights and solutions to evaluate client behaviors and to optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas.   

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Business Effectiveness - Identify and recommend changes that enhance operations whether through technology or other processes to ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.
  • Strategic Thinking Approach – Drive, manage and execute PBB data and reporting projects and initiatives in alignment with CIBC and PBB Strategy while supporting the business goals, objectives and KPIs. Ability to think strategically about how to mobilize and engage teams across the enterprise to deliver strategic change.
  • Relationship Management - Manage the relationship between the Data and Reporting and various partners throughout the bank with a high focus on client experience and partnering for shared success.  Build internal and external relationships as required to help ensure we are providing the right level of service to our leadership team and business partners. 
  • Communication -  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, processes, and technology solutions to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation.
  • Reporting - Track progress and conduct analysis of data and reports. Support in the tracking and communication of performance metrics.
  • Design & Develop: Act as a SME on the analysis of requirements. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative data and reporting solutions to meet business objectives.

Who You Are  

  • You can demonstrate experience in:  Various BI reporting solutions Cognos reports including Cognos Cubes , Tableau , Thoughtspot . ETL development like Alteryx , SAS . Database experience : Oracle , Netezza , Azure SQL . Microsoft Azure is an asset .
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. Understanding internal banking processes and how they translate into data outputs.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You use your relationships and technical knowledge to influence enterprise projects.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Toronto 750 Law Ave. W., W5

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Sr. Consultant, Analytics & Insights
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

                                                                                                      

STRATEGIC BUSINESS UNIT DESCRIPTION

At Simplii Financial, we’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at Simplii and CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about Simplii Financial, please visit simplii.com

JOB PURPOSE 

The Simplii Analytics & Insights team is seeking a Sr. Consultant Analytics to build and deliver compelling data driven stories. They will act as a strategic business partner, understand ambiguous requirements, and showcase the power of data by turning it into actionable recommendations. They will own specific projects and portfolios where deeper analysis is needed to understand the overall trends we are seeing in the business, and will provide insights to improve. This position will work closely with our team of analysts, the client experience team, and Simplii business leaders.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Measure the effectiveness of sales triggers vs. control groups; working collaboratively with client experience, product, and ECICM teams to continuously improve execution

  • Track and attribute Simplii new clients by their source of acquisition (channel, program, offer, etc.)

  • Ideate, develop, and then measure sales leads for the contact center and digital channels using internals client data, as well as external client data (including credit bureau)

  • Responsible for the extraction and analysis of complex information from a variety of databases.

  • Transform extracted data from large and disconnected datasets into insights suitable for presentation to various audiences.

  • Develop capabilities to identify areas of opportunity and improve business processes, data architecture and reporting efficiency.

  • Work collaboratively with business and analytics groups, on cross functional projects and data initiatives to solve business problems.

  • Design and implement models that provide insights into client behaviour

  • Extract, review and prepare data for analysis & reporting using SAS and/or SQL

CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS

  • Senior management within Simplii Financial and ASG

  • Business stakeholders in Simplii Product, Digital, Marketing, ECICM, Payments, and DFS

  • Various other CIBC departments (Enterprise Analytics, Legal, Compliance, Treasury, Finance, Risk Management)

COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS/RESPONSIBILITIES

  • As an employee of CIBC, the incumbent must comply with all applicable CIBC and Line of Business policies, standards, guidelines and controls.  

AUTHORITIES/DECISION RIGHTS 

  • As a key contributor to the business unit, this job has the authority to recommend changes to business processes in order to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.

HOW YOU’LL SUCCEED

  • Data driven - Give meaning to large sets of data and aggregate information from multiple sources to summarize it into a meaningful ensemble.

  • Critical Thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities.  You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions. You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion.

  • Continuous improvement mindset - Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements

  • Communication and Relationship Management - You get things done, but it is always done in collaboration with your peers and stakeholders. You will be a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the organization by understanding their needs, and presenting a credible and compelling plan that meets those needs.

WHO YOU ARE

  • You have a degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or related quantitative fields

  • You can demonstrate experience in. Expert knowledge of SAS and SQL. Knowledge of advanced Excel functionality including pivot tables, charts, string manipulation, lookups, and filters. It\'s an asset if you have experience with visualization tools like Tableau.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • This role operates within a normal office environment with little exposure to adverse working conditions.

  • Ability to meet aggressive deadlines and business change requirements due to time sensitivity of competitive and market driven environment

  • Operating in a highly complex, and constantly evolving environment among a broad group of stakeholders where success will be dependent upon developing and maintaining effective partnerships

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Senior Manager, Automotive and Unsecured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Automotive and Unsecured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements).
  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Senior BI Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing You’ll join our Analytics & Decision Science team within Personal and Business Banking reporting into the Director, Business Intelligence and Strategy. As a Senior BI Analyst, you’ll be responsible, at a senior level, for delivering insightful dashboards and reporting to ensure that Product teams have the right information to make the right decisions at the right time. You’ll deliver a wide range of financial, behavioral, competitive analytic tools through the use of advanced business intelligence tools to help drive growth in our business. The successful candidate will be an energetic and self-motivated individual with exceptional consultative skills and an intense client focus.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytics & Reporting – Lead the delivery of fact-based  dashboards and reporting tools (Tableau , Cognos , Thoughtspot ) ,  ETL (SAS and Alteryx)  to influence decisions and/or identify gaps.  The expectation is to go well beyond the numbers and provide insightful product/business/customer/client/segment analysis tools. Contribute to the development and management of a reporting/analytical intake process. Prepare presentations that clearly and concisely communicate key findings and objectives
  • Consultation – Participate as a thought partner and provide advice and recommendations that assist in the development and evolution of our business mandate and help our business make Better Decisions Faster
  • Data Management - Work collaboratively with IT & Product teams to augment/acquire internal and external data and tools to facilitate better decision making.  Develop Strategies that ensure data accuracy, consistency, timely capture and standardization at the  client and account levels across varying product groups
  • Design & Develop: Act as a SME on the analysis of requirements. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative data and reporting solutions to meet business objectives.
  • Leadership - Actively seek and evaluate opportunities to improve existing processes and work with key stakeholders to implement changes where appropriate. Contribute to the ongoing development and enhancement of a suite or reports and dashboards, data management and business intelligence tools that leverage industry best practices with respect to flexibility, sensitivity and reporting to allow enhanced support of the diverse range of clients across the business

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in:  Various BI reporting solutions Cognos reports including Cognos Cubes , Tableau , Thoughtspot . ETL development like Alteryx , SAS . Database experience : Oracle / Netezza / Azure SQL . Microsoft Azure is an asset .
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business and technical  problems and recommend solutions
  • You can demonstrate a deep understanding of developing dashboards, reporting, insights generation.  Accuracy and attention to detail are a must
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class on-boarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Senior Manager, Pricing Analytics, Personal Lending
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, New Channels and Products, this position will work with key partners in Risk, Product Analytics and other stakeholders as required, establish reliable empirical foundations for pricing and accepting risk within Unsecured Lending, and for optimizing rate, 3rd party incentives and other factors to maximize long-term risk adjusted returns. The Senior manager will collaborate with internal stakeholders as well as external credit bureau agencies to enable the development of industry specific models and score cards to assess customer probability of default and profitability levels for current and new digital unsecured lending channels. You will also be accountable for building and maintaining analytic and reporting foundations around the product.


At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.
 

How You’ll Succeed

1. Contribute to the development of credit models to predict risk and other key outcomes at the Client and Merchant by vertical level

2. Will leverage and apply these models and scorecards to the business; and will collaborate with Risk and Finance partners, as well as other internal stakeholders to drive continuous improvement to these model

3. Execute the development of client pricing strategies and merchant incentive structures that optimize long-term risk-adjusted returns.

4. Maintain ongoing accountability to Risk and other partners for business results

5. Work with Risk, Analytics & Decision Science and credit bureau agencies, along with other stakeholders to build partnerships and learn and apply best practices, and share learnings developed in Personal Lending.

6. Develop key measures and reports necessary to track and manage the effectiveness of existing models.

7. Maintain an awareness of industry trends and products, particularly in the area of bureau scores and bureau data, and other data sources and techniques that could be used to predict risk-adjusted profitability.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in retail lending, 3 plus years’ experience in predictive analytics with elements of credit risk and profit optimization related to retail Unsecured Lending. Proven experience with advanced analytics concepts in context of retail lending. Ability to research and analyze complex data for segmentation and trend analysis

  • You have a University degree with strong knowledge of mathematics/statistics, engineering or other STEM disciplines, applied in a business context.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Consultant, BI Development
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to Senior Manager, BI Development, you will be responsible for development of Contact Centres’ Insights and Analytics solutions, working closely with Business Analysts as well as Technology and Business Partners in a fast-paced Agile environment.   

You will be working with structured and semi-structured data, building relational and multi-dimensional Data Models, Analytics and Reporting Solutions to enable data-driven decision making for partners across CIBC Contact Centres LOBs.  

How You’ll Succeed

  • Deliver Timely and Accurate Solutions – Design, develop and deliver data models and reporting satisfying user requirements. Ensure data presentation is accurate, intuitive, timely and visually appropriate for broad spectrum of stakeholders audience comprehension. Ensure ease of maintenance and proper access controls.

  • Technology – leverage data and analytical tools to analyze structured and unstructured datasets, build data models, reporting and visualization solutions from multiple data sources.   

  • Establish & Maintain Business Relationships – Develop strong relationships with peers, Business and Technology Partners through meetings, presentations and consulting.

  • Communication – Flexible in communicating at different technical levels for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in utilizing Business Intelligence & Visualization software applications for 4-5 years to develop data models and reporting (Tableau/Cognos or similar). You can give meaning to data and enjoy making sense of information. You are able to consult business partners to formulate their BI requirements. You have  3-5 years’ experience with RDBMS and  data warehouse and strong SQL skills.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering or equivalent practical work experience in a related field.

  • It’s an asset if you are familiar with Agile work environment. 

  • Nice to have:  Working knowledge of web applications, programming languages, and web services, such as .NET, C#, CSS, cross-browser compatibility, HTML, JavaScript, JQuery, ASP, and web user interface design (UI)

  • You embrace and champion change. You continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver best possible solutions. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • Values matter to you. You live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

item.title: Sr. Analyst, Fraud Management
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Analytics Consultant you will be doing ongoing data analysis associated with rules management within CIBC’s fraud mitigation systems.

You will conduct large data extraction and manipulations using SAS for fraud reporting. As well as, assist the team in the development and application of complex statistical concepts/theories and predictions including cost/benefits analysis, optimization, predictive models  and sampling.

  • Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytical Thinking –Improve fraud monitoring by responding to fraud trends and mitigate risk surrounding operational processes. Conduct feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis to clearly depict possible fraud mitigation rule options and recommended courses of action.

  • Data Management – Creation and maintenance of SAS and SQL programs to access a decision support data repository.  Database management/querying, and computer programming/software expertise.

  • Communication Skills–  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Based discipline.

  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.

  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.

item.title: Fusion Reporting Consultant
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

As a Fusion Reporting Consultant, you will provide expert and specialized reporting.  You will play a key role in the build, reconciliation and automation of operational reporting across Fusion teams.  You will develop Key Performance Indicator (KPI) business benefit, and Key Risk Indicator (KRI) reporting to support Fusion Program delivery.  You will also develop risk, governance, operational, and regulatory reporting for the Fusion team as required. You will be a subject matter expert in developing robust methodologies for reporting and dashboarding. Utilize creative thinking and apply mathematical, financial and statistical methods in the design/development of new analysis to support strategic decision making.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role  you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Reporting – Design, develop and deliver visual reporting using state of the art visual reporting tools. Provide complex analytical reporting capability to Fusion business units based on requirements combined with a business assessment of each functional unit’s business needs. Develop an operational measurement & reporting plan for new initiatives and use cases, as well existing business operations processes. Deliver monthly dashboards such as use case benefits, Operational performance Dashboards, Incident management reporting, Intelligence threat reporting, Executive Business and Partner dashboards which provide Fusion with the ability to measure the success of our business and provide insight into areas to focus.

  • Consulting - Identify emerging risk issues/trends and assess/recommend deficiencies. Develop robust methodologies for forecasting operational performance. Utilize creative thinking and apply mathematical, financial and statistical methods in the design/development of new analysis. Support project implementation as it relates to new business activities and/or internal initiatives. Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend solutions. Conduct meetings and presentations to share data, information, findings and expertise on relevant topics with partners, Fusion Leadership team, and executive leadership.

  • Analytics – Manage analysis and interpret results to determine risk attributes, trends, root causes and key drivers of results. Design, development of code and processes to carry out the extraction, manipulation, transformation and delivery of data extracts & data sets in SQL & SAS. Create processes and code to automate delivery of new and existing standard analytics & reporting in SAS, Tableau and Microsoft Office. Deliver moderately complex data quality extract and manipulation reviews using SAS / SQL and deliver feedback on those reviews. Apply creative thinking to overcome limitations in data availability and data quality

  • Relationship Management - Develop and maintain productive relationships with management, peers and others across all lines of business. Collaborate with Business Controls, Risk, and regulatory teams.

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate experience with reporting models, databases/ data management and visualization tools, such as SAS, SQL, Tableau and VBA (extensive working experience with Tableau and SAS or SAS EG is required, Dashboard building using Tableau)

  • You have knowledge of Security/Risk and are able to understand and interpret data and information related to Information Security, Fraud, Corporate  Security, Fusion, AML, etc.

  • You have a degree/diploma in computer science, mathematics, statistics / similar area or an equivalent combination of training and experience in reporting and software development.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way for business, operations and management to make sound decisions.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

**Prior to starting in this role, security checks, including a criminal record check must be successfully completed to the satisfaction of CIBC. An annual criminal record check may also be required.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.
